key_insight: eMOSAIC combines multimodal molecular and protein information with per‑sample out‑of‑distribution (OOD) uncertainty estimates to produce more accurate and trustworthy binding affinity predictions across multiple targets (polypharmacology).
problem_solved: Conventional affinity models fail silently on novel compounds or targets and lack individualized OOD uncertainty, limiting reliable prediction and prioritization in polypharmacology settings.
method: Fuse multimodal inputs (e.g., chemical structures, protein sequence/structure, assay/context) into a unified prediction model.
Estimate individual OOD uncertainty for each prediction (uncertainty-aware inference) to identify low-confidence cases.
Use uncertainty information during training/inference to improve ranking and decision-making for compounds with multiple target interactions.
impact: Provides AI/ML practitioners in drug discovery with calibrated, per‑example confidence signals that improve experimental prioritization, reduce costly false leads, and increase trust when deploying affinity models across novel chemical and biological spaces.
visual_elements: Schematic pipeline: multimodal inputs (molecule, protein, assay) → eMOSAIC model → affinity + OOD confidence
Calibration/uncertainty heatmap showing OOD scores across compounds and targets
Scatter plot of predicted vs. measured affinities with error bars colored by uncertainty (high vs low confidence)
Network diagram of a compound linked to multiple protein targets with confidence badges to illustrate polypharmacology
paper_title: Multimodal out-of-distribution individual uncertainty quantification enhances binding affinity prediction for polypharmacology
paper_authors: Amitesh Badkul, Li Xie, Shuo Zhang, Lei Xie
